Pre-Game Insights: The biggest worry for an Indian cricket fan is not losing to Pakistan, it is an India-Pakistan encounter getting washed out due to an 80% chance of rain in Melbourne.
India's record of being undefeated against Pakistan in World Cups since 1992 was taken away last year, with the current standing at India 12-1 Pakistan.
India's stronger suit is batting while Pakistan's is bowling, which was decisive in 2021 when Shaheen Shah Afridi ran through India's top-order.
India has gone close to winning ICC Global tournaments multiple times in the last ten years but has regularly fallen short.
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, and Hardik Pandya are key players for India in this match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is scheduled to take place at MCG, Melbourne on Sunday, October 23, 2022.
Head-to-head record in T20 World Cups: India 5 wins, Pakistan 1 win.
Head-to-head record in Australia (across formats): India 4 wins, Pakistan 3 wins.
